p: Remdesivir, a nucleotide analogue prodrug with broad-spectrum antiviral activity ( Sheahan et al., 2017, Mulangu et al., 2019), has shown promising activity against SARS-CoV-2 in vitro ( Wang et al., 2020a). Two case reports ( Holshue et al., 2020, Kujawski et al., 2020) and a recent clinical study of 54 patients ( Grein et al., 2020) showed encouraging results in COVID-19 patients. Conversely, a randomized study did not show any significant clinical benefit, although it probably lacked power ( Wang et al., 2020b).
